source.449b2f48:
def barPlotVirus(variable):
    """
    input : variable : "Active"
    output : bar plot & value count
    """
    var = countryWise[variable]
    varValue = var.value_counts()
    plt.figure(figsize=(9,5))
    plt.bar(varValue.index,varValue.values)
    plt.xticks(varValue.index,varValue.index.values)
    plt.ylabel("Frequency")
    plt.title(variable)
    plt.show()
    print("{} : \n {}".format(variable,varValue))

def plotHistVirus(variable):

    plt.ylabel("Frequency")
    plt.title("{} variable showing with hist".format(variable))
    plt.show()

source.2d40cb20:
def detectOutliers(df,features):
    outlier_indices=[]
    for c in features:
        Q1=np.percentile(df[c],25)
        Q2=np.percentile(df[c],75)
        IQR = Q2-Q1
        outlierStep = IQR*1.5
        outlierListCol = df[(df[c] < Q1-outlierStep) | (df[c]>Q2+outlierStep)].index
        outlier_indices.extend(outlierListCol)
    outlier_indices=Counter(outlier_indices)
    multiple_outliers=list(i for i,v in outlier_indices.items() if v>2)
    return multiple_outliers

    ),
    title="Show Both Rates of Has Most Confirmed Countries in South-East Asia That Recovered / 100 Cases and One week increase"
)

fig = go.Figure(data=data, layout=layout)
iplot(fig)

source.e1b9ffff: # Variable Description 1. Confirmed : Confirmed total cases counts 2. Deaths : Counts of dead because of epidemic 3. Recovered : Recovered people counts from epidemic 4. Active : Counts peoples that has virus 5. New cases : New cases people counts 6. New deaths: New Deaths people counts 7. New recovered : new recovered people counts 8. Deaths / 100 Cases : Rates that divide of counts deaths and counts of cases multiplication to 100 9. Recovered / 100 Cases : Rates that divide of counts recovered and counts of cases multiplication to 100 10. Deaths / 100 Recovered : Rates that divide of deaths and recovered of cases multiplication to 100 11. Confirmed last week : Confirmed counts of cases from virus last week 12. 1 week change : Counts of Increasing confirmed cases in one week 13. 1 week % increase : Rates of counts of increasing confirmed cases in one week 14. Country/Region : According to Country/Region 15. WHO Region : According to region
